sense.name: Attack physically, usually with some implement.
sense.examples: They bombarded one another with snowballs. The Americans bombarded Dresden. Afghan guerillas bombarded Kabul in a mass offensive.

sense.name: Address (verbally or in writing) continuously or persistently
sense.examples: The speaker was bombarded by an angry audience. The governor was bombarded with requests to grant a pardon to the convicted killer.

sense.name: Direct high energy particles or radiation against.
sense.examples: Ion beams are used to bombard the cells. Radiation treatments bombard the cancer in an effort to kill it.
